TranslatedText: On Tuesday evening ministers Gelmini, Bianchi and Giovannini had reached an agreement with the Regions and local authorities: for the superiors, the minimum threshold of attendance in class was 60%. But yesterday the Council of Ministers changed the compromise reached: Prime Minister Mario Draghi has set a teaching in the presence of 70 in the yellow and orange areas, while in the red areas the percentage fluctuates between 50 and 75 percent. “I regret that the constructive contribution of all the regions of Italy has not been accepted. As a conference we showed that in a moment of emergency we can find unity regardless of political membership by presenting feasible proposals and balance” says the governor of Friuli Venezia Giulia who judges “a very serious precedent” the having changed “in the Council of Ministers an agreement signed by the Conference of Regions with Municipalities through ANCI and with the provinces through Upi”.
